metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27783 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A XSS vulnerability was discovered in python-lxml's clean module. Themodule's parser didn't properly imitate browsers, which caused differentbehaviors between the sanitizer and the user's page. A remote attackercould exploit this flaw to run arbitrary HTML/JS code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27783` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-lxml - 3.3.3-1ubuntu0.2+esm2
python3-lxml - 3.3.3-1ubuntu0.2+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lxml package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.3.3-1ubuntu0.2+esm2').
